benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Request: The happy-path tests (TC01, TC02) cover successful creation of tags for an invoice item with single and multiple tags.

Invalid Payload / Validation: Tests for missing required header (TC06), invalid invoice item id format (TC07), non-existent invoice item (TC08), malformed JSON (TC09), empty tag list (TC10), invalid tag definition UUID (TC11), extra/unsupported parameters (TC12), duplicate tag definitions (TC13), null/empty values in payload (TC24).

Server Error Handling: Tests for missing header (400), non-existent item (404), malformed body (400), too large payload scenarios (TC19), service unavailable (TC17), dependency/service down (TC21), unauthorized access (TC16), timeout (TC25).
Boundary/edge cases: Existing tags on item (TC04), item with no tags (TC05), heavy load (TC14), maximum tags scenario (TC23), partially populated DB (TC22), regression duplicate handling (TC20).
Various success cases beyond basic creation: multiple tags (TC01), single tag (TC02), optional headers (TC03), and behavior when item already has tags (TC04) (with extended coverage via TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets or listing tags with pagination semantics.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or related cache validation.
Rate Limiting: No tests assessing behavior under rapid successive requests or throttling.
Authorization granularity: While TC16 covers missing header, there isn’t explicit coverage for 403 forbidden in case of insufficient permissions (only 401).
Concurrency/Race conditions: No explicit tests for concurrent tag additions to the same invoice item.
recommendations: Add pagination-focused tests for listing or retrieving tags when there are many tags (to exercise server-side pagination).
Add tests for caching headers and validation of cache-related behavior on responses.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling under bursty traffic.
Include a test scenario for 403 Forbidden to cover insufficient permission cases beyond 401 Unauthorized.
Add explicit concurrency/race-condition tests to verify consistent behavior when multiple clients tag the same invoice item simultaneously.
